name: Subway
vicinity: Sf-Z Gates Post Security, 45020 Aviation Drive, Sterling

reviews.text: Someone charged me for an extra meal.  I bought one meal around 8am then bought a coffee at starbucks 20 minutes later then someone there charged me for the exact meal price at the subway. Everyone check your bank statements online.  See if you got robbed.
Not sure what some of these bad reviews are talking about. Super fast service, great sandwich. They work faster here than any subway I’ve ever been to

Every time I have patronized this establishment,  in the day time & the two Latina women are there, it's a "HORRIBLE " experience.  Today, 1/24/2019 @ approximately 11am, I noticed that their work area was untidy,  the trays of food (cold- cuts & vegetables) had pieces of other foods mixed in, crumbs, and the lettuce was brown & wilted.  Their using gloves, but they're touching everything,  including their hair & wiping off their clothing; then have the audacity to want to serve the sandwich with the same gloves on. Their attitude is sub-par, completely disrespectful, and utterly an extremely poor example of quality customer service.  They're sooooooooooo unprofessional  !!!! I've complained several times, but evidently, they're done "nothing " to address their behavior.  I don't only give poor reviews,  I took the opportunity to share with them how completely opposite their overnight male employee acts & treat every customer I see him interact with, with the utmost respect & have forged positive relationships with them. He greet's customers with a smile, I see him cleaning up, keeping the food trays presentable & have told managment,  that he need to be clowned ! For, he makes customers want to return. But since these two ladies refuse to show decorum & care about the food they serve, or even practicing the food & drug guidelines, next time, I'm just going to call the health department,  instead asking to correct things on-the-spot, because I shouldn't be the one needing to point these things out to them. If they cared or had more management oversight,  I could just simply come in, purchase my items as intended & leave. I won't be buying any food there, anytime soon unless its during the overnight shift; so I can rest assure to get quality service from someone that cares how he represents himself & the company which employs them.

One of the worst places. It just ruined my day. The people are so rude and unprofessional. I don't even understand why would you hire someone like that. There were 2 attendants and carry really bad attitude towards customers. Very ill mannered and unethical.

A big Zero to this place. Would never suggest anyone to visit.

The lady and the gentleman are really rude and unprofessional. The chicken they provided was uncooked and the place is not tidy. I suggest you guys to never go to this place. They have no sense on how to behave with customers. The lady laughed over apologising when given the feedback.

This is extremely bad. I suggest the person who owns the store to hire better people

name: Vino Volo
vicinity: Dulles International Airport, 1 Saarinen Circle Concourse B - Gate, B63, Dulles

reviews.text: Wow pretty good wine and pretty good food. Airport fare has improved! I enjoyed the truffle flatbread. I added prosciutto! The quinoa salad was healthy and tasty! They got us in and out quickly. The prices were not cheap but not exorbitant. If you have to eat at the airport and want a civilized meal, this place does the trick.

Had time to use at the airport so we stopped here and ordered wine along with a charcuterie board. Everything was amazing and tasted great. We also ordered the Apple dessert and that was DELICIOUS! It was warmed up so it tasted so fresh. I could eat 4 of those apple “hand pies”. Stop by this place if you are in section B when flying out.

A great area to sit in and have wine lunch and dessert. The prosciutto brie and pepper jelly made a great combination and melt down flourless cake took care of my chocolate attack. The music and people watching is great.

The avocado beet salad is fantastic. I suggest you try it. I did that Christmas cabs flight it’s a bit pricey is $31 in the tasting I think Bella little bit short on the amount in the glasses but the presentation of course is fantastic. The staff has been also very friendly
Service was excellent. But food is not very good. The pasta had no flavor and tasted like dollar store mac & cheese

name: Subway
vicinity: Subway C Gate, 44844 Package Court, Sterling

reviews.text: I had a long wait for my flight and wanted to eat something healthy. I almost didn’t find this  Subway store tucked all the way down at gate C1 at Dulles airport. I’m glad I kept walking until I found it. My sandwich was so fresh- the wheat bread was tasty and chewy, and the spinach and other vegetables were fresh. What really impressed me was how friendly the woman and young man were. They greeted me as if they cared I was there. I sat at the little tables at the edge of the shop to eat, and I could hear the nice woman greet everyone, and the young man take an interest in each customer.  He patiently explained the menu to those that needed it. It’s really a pleasure to hear kindness that comes from the heart. Most likely, the shop won’t get repeating customers since they are at an airport gate- so it impresses me even more that the people who work here are cheery.

A little hard to find, but this restaurant has fed me many times on transcontinental flights. When you are walking from the security checkpoint to the gates, make a left soon after leaving the security checkpoint. It's at the end of the corridor of the Z gates. The good thing is that few people know it's there, so I've never had to wait. I just hope that they don't go out of business.
Taste like it's supposed too. 😀
Pretty standard and the only option near z gates.
Amazing service would most definitely visit again, sandwich was amazing as well.

name: Be Right Burger
vicinity: Gate C14, Main Terminal Washington Dulles International Airport, Concourse C, Saarinen Circle, Dulles

reviews.text:
I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and quantity of food my 7 yeard old and I got here. Pricing was reasonable for an airport ($9.29 for a huge cheeseburger, $3.59 for a cup of fries, and $5.98 for 3 very large chicken strips). I haven't seen a hamburger patty this thick in any restaurant in years (even bars).
The food also tasted very good.
Yes, airport food is always expensive; however, for the first time ever, I felt like we actually got some quality food for that high price.

STAY AWAY!!!

The quality of this fast food place is below average.

Let’s start with the pricing. Almost everything on the menu is priced 15% higher than a regular fast food restaurant. Obviously it’s the airport but for what you get, save your money.

The quality…
If you order chicken, whether it’s the chicken sandwich or chicken strips, you’re getting frozen breaded chicken patty’s or strips from some dollar general or horrible convenience store. It tasted like someone poured liquid chicken into a bag and threw bread crumbs on it and fried it on the grill. Then the sweet potato fries were not crispy at all, tasted like they weren’t even cooked properly because the insides were still mushy and seemed like they were falling apart. The food they are getting is super processed and disgusting.

Not to mention, the sanitation level was below average as workers can be seen eating food as they bring your order to the counter.

It’s quite evident there is little to no care for the condition of this restaurant.

I stopped here to get a hamburger and fries a few days ago.  I decided on a hangover double.  The burger was huge and messy.  I liked the flavor.  It was nice to have something a little different than normal.  It was pretty expensive.  Almost $20 for a burger, fries and a drink.

The entire dining area inside the restaurant was closed.  I’m not sure if they didn’t have the staff to keep it clean or if it was due to COVID.

After I was given my food I asked an employee for some salt.  He looked directly at me and said “salt?”   I said yes.  He reached over and grabbed a few packages of pepper and handed them to me.  He walked away before I could say anything.

I would probably eat there again.  I wouldn’t order a double.  The single would have been plenty of food.

After the the long wait to have my order fulfilled, thought at least my food would be hot and fresh but it wasn’t. Sloppily assembled, greasy, unseasoned  burger with pieces ripped off the stale bun. Nothing was hot, mealy tomatoes, cheese not melted, etc. Tater tots were golden brown but they were cold and very greasy. They seem to prepare all of their food ahead of time and just pop everything in a microwave for a few seconds before serving. Who wants a reheated meal that tastes and looks like 2 day old leftovers? Not worth the $. Won’t eat here again.

I thought it was great. Menu was a bit limited as it was breakfast, i ordered an item with turkey to avoid pork sausage. Server was cool and waiting wasn't too long. As for the sandwich itself it tasted like you average McDonald's sandwich. Can't complain.

name: Smashburger
vicinity: 1 Saarinen Circle, Sterling

reviews.text: Fast and efficient, good food. Tends to get a little overcrowded and the line to pick up your burger tuns into the dining room. Still, you wont get much better food at the airport. Fries are phenomenal, but the burger came out looking kind of sad. Great QUICK bite before takeoff on my connection.

Hot, relatively fast. Packed seating but relatively efficient use of space. Generous with the fries but not the burger. Smash should be the style of cooking not the look of the end product. Was disappointed that an upsell burger did not include the regular toppings as well. Overall not the best experience but prices were inflated because of location and if I go again I will be better prepared.

Great service. Fast and friendly. A perfect stop at the airport for delicious burgers and sweet potato fries!! They also offer lettuce wrapped burgers or gluten free buns. The sweet potato fries are made gluten free in their own fryer as well.

For a burger on the run, this airport Smashburger did the trick. A $10 burger with all the trimmings was enough for two of us to share. Sure, it didn’t stuff us, but it was enough to satisfyingly tide us over and didn’t break the bank. It was also delicious.
We did self-serve takeaway so I can’t speak to the service. It didn’t take us long to get our food and be on our way.
I ate here during a delay in my travels to NC and the burger itself was delicious.  I substituted the pickles on the classic smash for jalepenos and they had no issue with it at all.  Good burger.

name: Wendy's
vicinity: 44825 Delta Road, Sterling

reviews.text: Conveniently located near the B-40s gates. It's okay. Sometimes the lines are long, sometimes not.  Prices at this airport location are definitely higher than other Wendy's, but in general, it's one of the least expensive eating options on the B concourse. Sure beats $12 grab-and-go sandwiches at the Stellar News location!

Slooooow service.  It amazes me that places inside of airports operate slower than their counterparts outside.  There were 3 people in line ahead of me, and it took 15 minutes to get a pre-made salad.  Meanwhile, another FF restaurant (ends with fil-A and starts with Chick) had twice the customers and took half as long.  I can’t really blame the workers, they are probably underpaid, and you get what you pay for.  The good part- the salad was pretty decent, but not worth $10.  Oh, and they ask for a tip if you pay with a credit card.

Standard burgers 🍔 and fries 🍟.  Lemonade quite nice.
Clerk noted my order incorrectly for chicken instead of beef, but they corrected at the end, so fine.
They're aboit 30 tables and chairs in front for dinning, so enough to take a place when not crowded

Airport outlet is bad.. Asked for one combo and one swich, they billed me for two combos.. And to top it..Don't ever go for their Mozerella Sandwich.. It no way resembles what they show in the picture.. The cheese inside doesn't flow at all.. It's like any other cheese slice.. But fried.. And tastes awful..

Luckily they were open...and the Only place open for our 11am flight. The food tasted very fresh, and the team helping us was polite, helpful, and fast. It was the best experience I've had at a Wendy's in some time.

name: The Kitchen by Wolfgang Puck
vicinity: Concourse A Gate A22, Dulles

reviews.text: Ended up getting the pepperoni pizza for a meal between flights.   They were quick and efficient.  The pizza had a good taste but I don't think the oven was hot enough.   The crust was very floppy and not crisp.  Overall not a bad deal for a quick pizza fix.

The service was fine (thanks Edy!) but the suggested tips on the receipt for the amount of the bill were more than double the actual calculation. For my $15.50 glass of wine a 20% tip should have been $3.10 but the receipt says a 20% tip is $7.60, or almost 50% of the bill. Not implying that workers don’t deserve good tips - they certainly do - but don’t BS customers this way. Taxes, rounding up, etc. do not account for the difference. Please see photo.

The Ethiopian looking lady has such lousy service. Giram or Garam. Took time to clean table and seat us. Never bothered to check in on us and what we needed. Even when you got her attention she wasn’t keen to help and she talks back.
Food was average. Chicken burger was missing some ingredients.  Sucks to spend money at places like this.

I came here for breakfast. The menu had very few options.  I had the classic breakfast with 2 soft-poached eggs and sausage. It was pitiful portions. One sausage link. About 20 hashbrowns. They couldn't quite make the eggs right, and asked me if they were okay. I accepted them because I didn't want to wait any longer. Why would Wolfgang Puck put his name on this place. Don't eat breakfast here.

We had Girmay as our server. Out of 3 people she got two drinks right. We’re talking two of the same soda and an orange (I didn’t know if she was bringing soda or juice for the orange but we already were getting skeptical).
So one of the sodas showed up as a water. It was ordered as “I’ll have what he’s having” and he successfully got his?

We then asked about options for a dairy food allergy, explained that included milk cheese and butter and then she asked what the allergy was to. We couldn’t eat here because even if I talked to the chef myself we can’t trust this lady to not mess it up.
She also did take her time picking up our  check up even though I tried to hand it right back to her. And snatched the menu out from my friend (while we were still considering if we could eat here) rather than walk to get another from the entrance for the table behind us

name: Pei Wei
vicinity: 1 Saarinen Circle, Dulles

reviews.text: Really fresh ingredients. Well prepared. I had Kung Pao Chicken and it was excellent. Not sugary or salty. Lots of flavor.
Chicken was tough and the sauce was too oily. Small portion and too pricy. Staff was very kind.

Pei Wei is a great place to get a bite to eat before catching your flight. The service is very good and the food is made quickly. We had our order within 10 minutes of ordering, and there were a few people ahead of us. Their Dan-Dan Noodles is delicious and the portion is good. One order is enough for q decent dinner. Overall, great experience.

I ordered the peiwei spicy chicken. The sauce was sweet, sour, and spicy. It was actually a bit too sweet.  The portions were very small for the price and they barely gave me any rice. I had about 5 pieces of chicken left by the time I had finished my rice. The chicken was cooked well and properly breaded.

Not worth walking 15 min in the airport for the foods in Pei Wei. Either too sweet or not well cooked. If there are any other restaurants near your location, don’t bother to go to Pei Wei. It has successfully failed me twice.

name: Dunkin'
vicinity: International Airport, Dulles International Airport Dulles, Sterling

reviews.text: Went to the Dunkin Express, they were selling day olds in the morning. I was excited to get a fresh donut to start my day.
Open 24 hours, except when there's no one there to man the shop.
Stood in a relatively short line for a half-hour. Dunkin’ Donuts corporate, if you are reading this. MAKE THE MENU SHORTER. Clearly the workflow can’t keep up with the complexity of the menu.

At the Dulles airport on a Sunday, we didn't expect our sausage and egg one with cheese crossaints to be burnt. It was hunger pains that made my husband and I endure, but the egg was frozen and the bread was overcooked because it had to put back into the toaster oven more than once to thaw out the frozen egg patties.

The worst Dunkin donut locations in the nation. I’m talking about all 3 locations that they have at Dulles international. All 3 are pretty bad.
I’m at Dulles international every week so I have tried them quite a few times. Each time was a disaster. Beginning with the fact that their donuts are NEVER fresh (they look and taste like they are a week old) ending up with rude and unfriendly employees who barely speak English. They will also charge you for hot water…also you’ll pay extra for a different size of tea (so you end up paying for hot water after all since it only comes with 1 tea bag). They went through a change of ownership in the past but that did not change a thing. I do not recommend this place.

name: Auntie Anne's
vicinity: 44825 Delta Rd, Chantilly

reviews.text: Highly recommend this place for a snack in the airport!!! Reasonable food prices and tasty hotdogs!!! $10 for all of this :)
Cinnamon sugar pretzel had little to no sugar on it. I know it's later in the day, but this is like they barely dusted it, so it's more like a plain pretzel.
My son and I had a great time here during an extended layover. Thanks Robert V.!

If you're looking for pretzels nostalgic of visiting the mall and stumbling on a haven of goodness while dead tired and way too stressed, this is the place. Because being in an airport is exactly like that and these pretzels are superb. They were thick, fresh, salty, and surprisingly reasonably priced for airport food. Extremely filling as well, the pretzel bites bucket easily feeds a starving and sleep deprived flier. Could probably feed two kids. The cheese was good, the dipping sauce had variety, and even the lemonade came in clutch with multiple flavors. This place was great, and the staff were extremely friendly, chipper and helpful. They also speak Spanish, which is good in an airport so international. For any weary traveler in search of filling, pretzely goodness, this is a perfect fit.

I gave them two stars only because there service was semi-fast. But when I got up to order my stuff they said oh we don't serve that here. So then I ordered something else and they said we also don't serve that here. No big deal just take it off the menu. Don't post it I wouldn't have wasted my time in line.

name: Starbucks (Gate C8)
vicinity: 44825 Delta Rd, Dulles

reviews.text: I received terrible customer service at store. I ordered a vanilla latte at 8:21 in the morning at Dulles Airport. I waited several minutes and began to notice customers who ordered drinks after me received their drinks. I kindly asked if their was a drink for me as maybe they missed it or there was a mistake. They said would have it up soon. Another several minutes went by and I went in line to get their attention again. The head barista at that time at this point was very rude even though it was clearly 20 minutes since I ordered. She personally made my drink and when I started to walk away was very condescending and said "You're welcome". I was very offended but didn't say anything. This was possibly the worst service I received at a Starbucks.
The employee told us "no time for mobile orders" and yelled at the people who were waiting to get them 😕

Well, it's just a bad starbucks which you sometimes encounter in this universe. The experience I had is just one of those rude behavior from the arrogant-looking owner who treated me not as a person, but as some random tourist who he thought would never see again so it's okay to treat him rude by intentionally putting my coffee too far so that I need to crawl over the counter to get it.

Literally the slowest Starbucks on the planet, literally. If there is a line, take the people mover over to the D terminal, or walk over to the B terminal. Seriously, you'll thank me. Oh yeah, hopefully the get your order correct after waiting in line for so long.

If you want to go to a location that takes 10 minutes per customer... where a line of 8 people takes over an hour to process.  Where you have to get on a flight after waiting 20 minutes for them to male your drink after paying... then you have come to the right place!

name: Bistro Atelier
vicinity: Chantilly

reviews.text: I ordered the English breakfast with a coffee and the bill came out to $20.76 before tip. They were out of potatoes but I was fine with subbing for French Fries. The food came out pretty quick and the server was really nice. Overall, the food and coffee were good. This is a decent place to eat at while you are waiting for your flight.

Rather rare full-service restaurant on the "nicer" side at Dulles. The menu looked upscale, but the food and service were mediocre. Wait staff was inattentive and my food sat in the window for a while, then the manager loudly yelled back to the kitchen that it was cold.

Salmon Benedict had to be eaten without the bread because the English Muffin was hard as a rock, even after being soaked with the yolk. Would be three stars but the options at Dulles are slim, so this gets the benefit of the doubt.

DONT EAT HERE! I’m also filing a report with the Health/ Food authority which governs thee food facilities in the airport.

We arrived in between flights to grab a bite to eat before our next flight. We were immediately seated but had to wait for a bit for service. They didn’t appear to be busy but no problem. We had about 45 mins to eat. Unlike other airports where if they ask if you have an upcoming flight, they didn’t inquire when we finally received service. We ordered two salads and three (3) Steak Frites Medium. As you can see below one was nearly raw. We asked if we be refunded for the raw one and they said no but they could redo it and we informed them that we had a flight. It took 12 minutes for the manager to come and see us to address it and he said there is nothing to be done as we didn’t have the time to wait.

Ridiculous and the manager should be replaced as it’s clear he’s not managing this facility well, can’t successfully deal with customers and fails to ensure that the wait staff receives the support needed from management.
Best burger in a long time. Mushroom plus Gruyere cheese.  Such a nice sublime tasty burger!  Sorry I took pictures after I bit into it but soooooo tasty. Service at the bar was awesome!
Good quality food for an airport that can be a little pricey, but overall good, the service is typically pretty quick here, but plan for enough time.

name: Au Bon Pain
vicinity: 1 Saarinen Circle, Dulles

reviews.text:
Has soup in the back and label the vegan ones vegan (thank you!); has main ingredients listed for the soups but not sub-ingredients (e.g. what the veggie stock is comprised of).

It would get higher marks if they had more vegan options.

🎉 The Good Day breakfast sandwich served on a warm, toasted baguette hit the spot after a long night of travel.

💵 Prices are reasonable, especially for an airport.

☕️ Double Espresso is $2 and you'll need it if you have a connecting flight on the other side of the airport.

Reasonable prices for sandwiches and salads (for an airport). My suggestion is to stop by if you have enough time between connecting flights in the morning - expect up to a 20 minute wait time. At the end of the day all that's left are their pre-packaged items. I hope they never get rid of the Smoked Salmon avocado sandwich! 😋

The little girl making sandwiches was very rude. I asked for the sweet turkey wrap. She gave me a blank stare. I repeated several time, but it did not register. I thought it was a language barrier, but she asked me in plain english to show her what I wanted on the overhead menu. That took several attempts. She finally said "we don't serve that sandwich". Understanding that due to the COVID not all options are available these days, so I asked if there was another menu of what they were serving. This obviously angered her. I asked about the chicken avocado. They had that one and she asked me to pay while she made my sandwich. The guy taking money was cool and really friendly. I went back to the sandwich bar and waited while she served sandwiches to everyone that came after me. When I was the last person there she asked if she could help me. "I'm waiting for a chicken wrap". Only then did she begin to make my sandwich (almost no condiments, very dry). She tossed my sandwich on the bar, turned her back to me and began cleaning again. Barely made my gate, last to board.

Please close. Messed up both my sandwiches.

Please close, and put something up where you order by kiosk and don’t have to explain your sandwich a dozen times.

name: Potbelly
vicinity: Dulles Int'l Airport, Terminal D, 1 Saarinen Circle, Dulles

reviews.text: I would not recommend this location as a pit stop at the IAD airport. Very rude management and that is very unfortunate as this is my first time stopping at this location. Definitely 2 thumbs down!

The turkey fresco was so refreshing as an alternative to the airport burger. We also ordered a ham and swiss, the cheese was melted perfectly and so fresh and clean tasting. The cookies I did stay away from the look addicting. Two drinks and sandwiches for 18 bucks a real win!

Don't buy anything from this store at the airport. They know you are in a rush and never come back and normally, you don't take the bill.
So they charge you for extra sandwiches and meals!

This restaurant is normally consistently great. The reason I'm giving it one star now is because the manager continually refuses to have cash on hand. A credit card is a promise. Cash money is real. If you refuse to accept my cash because you haven't prepared and don't have change. Then you will never get my business. I suggest you correct this now.
Quick no drama tasty meal nice staff and didn't cost a Wing and rudder ( a little airport humor....)

name: Five Guys
vicinity: Dulles International Airport, Concourse B, Gate B71, Dulles

reviews.text:
I love me some Five Guys! I was happy to find that there was a Five guys next to my gate before I flew out of IAD.
The burger and fries were exactly as I would have expected. There was not a very big line but the food took much longer than expected especially for five guys. I would recommend this location and would be happy to fly out of a gate next to it again.
This was a much better meal than what I have come to expect from most airport offerings. The price also reflected being in an airport as well. Pricing was a little steep

Fast food in a airport. Nothing more, nothing else. The staff was quick in taking and making the orders.
You can sit “inside” or they are some tables in the airport in front of the restaurants that a bigger.
Overall clean. Good for a snack before flying.

*MAKE SURE TO GET AN EXTRA CUP AS THEY GIVE A VERY GOOD AMOUNT OF FRIES * ;)

These guys are located in the B Gate in between B71 and 72 I think. They were fast in preparing and they gave a very good amount of fries and loved it. Taste was very good and did not have any issue having the food. Cheap and best .

Breakfast sandwich was surprisingly great!  The portion of bacon on it was generous, but I could have used less cheese. They’ll let you put any of the burger toppings on it — I recommend the grilled onion.

On the pricey side for what you get, but I’m not sure if that’s due to this being an airport location.

Rarely do you find a restaurant in the airport that stands up to the quality you expect at an off-site location. Early morning breakfast and the staff greeted me with face busting smiles and good cheer.  Great start to the day. Who knew 5 Guys had scrumptious breakfast sandwiches that pit all of their competition to shame. Expect a generous portion and typical 5 Guys fashion you can select how you want your gooey divine breakfast served. YUM

name: Capitol Grounds Coffee
vicinity: Washington Dulles International Airport Concourse B, 1 Saarinen Circle, Dulles

reviews.text: Long line to order. Breakfast sausage egg muffin taste good but the pancake and coffee are just okay.

Super fast and friendly service. Excellent, filling,  made to order breakfast sandwiches with fresh ingredients. Great coffee. Large variety of fresh baked goods like muffins and danishes. Truly impressed, definitely better than a chain. Would seek them out again!
Super quick service! The line was long, since it was the only thing open at 5 am and I probably only waited 5 minutes total to order and receive my food. Very impressive ! :)
The best breakfast and coffee experience I have ever had at an airport. They had someone taking orders ahead in the line which made them very quick. Wish more airport places were like this.

Quick and efficient service, the staff have always been friendly.  A food place to stop for a (relatively cheap) cup of coffee or a grab a quick sandwich to go.  It's not Starbucks, but you won't drop $8 on a cup of coffee here either.

name: Dulles Gourmet To Go
vicinity: Dulles International Airport, 1 Saarinen Circle #D5, Dulles

reviews.text:
While waiting on my return flight, my son and I stopped here to get some food around 10am. They were out of sausage. I ended up getting a bacon and cheddar sandwhich on a bagel. Bagel was the only option for bread. They had plain and sesame bagels to sell too.
I heard the cashier tell someone else that there was no cream cheese. They offered cranberry muffins and blueberry muffins. It didn’t look the freshest honestly. My kid got a muffin and he said it wasn’t bad. My sandwich was okay. I wish they had more options beyond a bagel for the bread. The cheese on the sandwich was eh haha. Not a bad option to hold you over.

Cheapest beer in the airport and about the only place you will find a table during the busy afternoon hours. Pro Tip: pay for a cheaper domestic beer and tell the tap person you got an IPA. The two operations are completely separate and they don't check receipts. (Disclosure: I have not done this).
One of two places open at 3AM with a wide variety of hot/cold food, sandwiches, bagels, wraps, salads, fruit, chips, etc etc
Decent coffee and tuna wrap. Not sure whats up with that lonely beer?
So so food. But I really like the hazelnut Vanilla coffee here.

name: Subway
vicinity: Dulles International Airport, 44950 Rudder Road, Sterling

reviews.text: This store is terrible.  I ordered online and when I arrived, they did not have my order ready.  Not only that, they claimed I never ordered and they had no record of it!  Then I showed them proof that I had.  Even after this, they wouldn't honor my order.  Moreover, they didn't honor the survey code I had received for filling out the survey from the last visit in which they also didn't have my order ready in time!

Went to get a sandwich and the staff said they are closed at 0830 PM where the sign said they open 24 hours. It is amassing there were 6 people waiting in line and the agent said the owner said no traffic and he would not pay the agent so they close early

I really don't appreciate the taste of their product and that is my right of preference...

However, I saw on TV, Yes On TV, the fact that for instance, their chicken sub is not healthy in the least. This was a year or three back, but I feel no reason to go there.
Subway outlet near the cell phone waiting area outside the terminal.  Service was prompt and polite, ingredients we're fresh.  The place was clean.  Just what you'd expect from a well-run facility.

Fresh Delicious Sub was good for me as I was feeling very hungry. I could sit inside and eat peacefully. 😊
Parking spot was easy to find. Thank you

name: District Chophouse
vicinity: 1 Saarinen Circle, Dulles

reviews.text:
For an airport restaurant… don’t expect it to be fast. We waited close to 20 minutes for the receipt. Still on the third time asking, the waitress kept asking if I needed it right now or if a bit later would be okay… I did say I needed to head out to Security very shortly. However the place was not busy. Not sure why she held on to it.
Prices are definitely at a premium but it is also the only restaurant prior to security so fine…
Gratuity is already included… which probably explains why services was not great as one doesn’t need to work for it…
Not worth it! I will not got back to this place anymore!
A true Oasis, great hospitality but still with hustle. Steak is worth the price. Even the staff seems happy to be here. Saying hi to customers like they’re old friends.

Was great to be able to sit and have a meal, but it was like 5 minutes of standing before anyone asked us to sit down. The food prices were decent and the presentation was great, but I had the fish and chips and it tasted like fish wrapped in a doggy corn dog bread. I just wasn't impressed. The service was decent, but even for as place that had limited guests and a number of employees, no one checked up on us much or asked us if we wanted more drinks or anything.

Ordered the Filet Mignon.  Asked for the Worcestershire Butter Cream, NO SHIITAKES AND NO GORGONZOLA.  20 min later got it with gorgonzola.  Complained.  3 min later got it plain.  It is CLEAR the steak was 'washed' and rewarmed.  The juices from the meat - ordered medium - were plain water.  And this was the most expensive item on the menu :-(

Explain to the host.  She said 'I am sorry'.  Got the bill and the charged 4.99 for the "preparation".  Complained.  They removed it.

0% service is what they got.  TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE...  If you need food, just go down to cheaper and better options.

My luggage was delayed at a layover, so I grabbed a bite here -- the only place at Dulles that you can sit down and grab a meal before passing through the TSA checkpoint. I went for a straight burger and fries. The fries were crispy, well seasoned, and topped with herbs. The burger patty felt a little dry and flavorless. I'd expect better quality meat at a place where the burgers are sixteen and change. The staff was friendly and delivered attentive service. The interior is clean and hides an attractive and well-stocked bar, certainly a welcome sight to the bland hospital-corridor style backdrop of the Washington Dulles Terminal.

name: Chick-fil-A
vicinity: 1 Saarinen Circle Terminal B, Dulles
